intro: Canthium pubipes, commonly known as the hairy spurge or rough spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically greenish-yellow in color. Canthium pubipes is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and dry forests.
